unnormalised: Flipkart's Big Billion Days sale concluded on 10/10/2024, with early estimates suggesting a GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) of ₹40,000 Cr. This figure represents a 15% increase compared to the previous year's sale, according to initial reports. Several factors contributed to this substantial growth, including a wider selection of products, increased digital penetration in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, and aggressive marketing campaigns.
normalised: Flipkart's Big Billion Days sale concluded on tenth October two thousand and twenty four, with early estimates suggesting a G-M-V (Gross Merchandise Value) of rupee forty thousand crore. This figure represents a fifteen percent increase compared to the previous year's sale, according to initial reports. Several factors contributed to this substantial growth, including a wider selection of products, increased digital penetration in Tier two and Tier three cities, and aggressive marketing campaigns.

unnormalised: Data indicates that mobile phones remained the top-selling category, accounting for approximately 40% of the total GMV. Electronics and appliances followed closely behind, contributing roughly 25%. Fashion and lifestyle products experienced a significant surge, with sales volumes increasing by 30% year-on-year. Notably, consumer durable goods also witnessed a healthy uptick in demand, driven by festive season purchases.
